  Adam Jack wrote:

  > What test runners do most ordinary folks [and not just the
  > junit experts who've been using it for years] use most, do
  > those runner primarily use collectors, and do suites add value to
  > those runners?

  I don't understand the intent of the question. Without the TestSuite
  class, the collectors couldn't do their work, so it seems to me.

My quick eyeballing of the ant code it used arrays of testcases and perhaps
even it's own runner, which in itself (not using the framework just the
testcase code) seems a shame to me. I'm not saying I'm right, this is just
what a quick look showed me.

I guess there is a constant tussle between a pure framework and use case,
but this feels like some sort of software evolution to me. I used to use
suites, I used to use the Swing Runner, but now I use Eclipse and I'll never
go back. When does the new user case become the norm? When does the
framework change to satisfy the new users?

regards,

Adam
